body: China’s COVID-19 Shutdown Is Beginning to Bite Apple https://www.billionaireclubcollc.com/chinas-covid-19-shutdown-is-beginning-to-bite-apple/ $AAPL

links.title: China's COVID-19 Shutdown Is Beginning to Bite Apple
links.description: Apple, Inc. AAPL, which was managing to churn out products and keep pace with the surging demand so far, may have hit a supply-chain roadblock with the protracted COVID-19 shutdown in China. What Happened: China's "zero COVID" policy to curb the spread of the deadly virus has impacted the assembly operation of Pegatron, Apple's second-largest contract manufacturer, TFI Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo said in a tweet on Monday.

$FB $AAPL $WIMI  
As the first share of metaverse holographic AR, WIMI with immersive content experience is one of the most important forms of this primary stage of metaverse, and brings more significant user experience improvement. The software is launched with UGC platform ecology and social platform that can build virtual relationship network respectively, and the underlying hardware support is still inseparable from the mobile devices that have long become popular today. Meanwhile, VR/AR and other technologies have gradually matured and are expected to achieve the short-term requirements of the metaverse and can evolve with the development of the metaverse. Therefore, WIMI is persuasive as a quality growth stock in 2022.

$WATT found a conjecture: Energous seems to have relations with SES-Imagotag. The company does electronic shelves and sold 160m (yes MILLION) tags in 2018. It was then acquired by BOE which is a Chinese giant electronics company which is in IOT and, wait for it, OLED screens. $AAPL has been dying to get them to supply displays and after 2 quality control failures (2019), BOE displays made it into the iPhone 13. Now Apple owns a large part of Dialog in their 600m dollar deal (which probably compensated for making Dialog invest 25m into Energous)  and since makes most of its own chips. Thus  tying in the screen and battery into the RF WPT manufacturing ecosystem would totally make sense. Haven't found a connection between Apple and Grepow yet but Apple batteries are often featured on the Grepow blog, especially L-shaped ones, which Grepow produces as well.

links.title: Mac Shipments Up in Q1 2022 Amid Worldwide PC Shipment Decline
links.description: Apple's worldwide Mac shipments were slightly up in the first quarter of 2022, according to new PC shipping estimates shared this afternoon by Gartner. Apple shipped an estimated 7 million Macs during the quarter, up from 6.5 million in the year-ago quarter, marking 8.6 percent growth.

Apple iPhone Shezhen factory shut down nearly a month until now.

Foxconn stops iPhone assembly in Shenzhen as China imposes a new COVID-19 lockdown
https://www.imore.com/foxconn-stops-iphone-assembly-shenzhen-china-imposes-new-covid-19-lockdown

links.title: Foxconn stops iPhone assembly in Shenzhen due to local COVID-19 lockdown
links.description: Foxconn has closed its Shenzhen operations following a local COVID-19 outbreak. Chinese officials have ordered non-essential businesses to close until March 20. Some manufacturing has been moved to other Foxconn factories. Apple supplier Foxconn has stopped building iPhones and other products in Shenzhen, China after local authorities put the city into lockdown over a fresh COVID-19 outbreak.

message.body:
$NVDA $AMD $GOOGL $AMZN $AAPL 
  
Note that while a couple of dbag no nothing analysts from no name firms are calling big cap tech"overvalued" and suggesting supply chain problems and "cancelled orders" are a disaster all of the sudden, it is all BS imo.  Take NVDA for example... now trading at call it 2x the relative (S&P 500) multiple... while growing at least 4x as fast, and now the valuation really needs to be discounting NVDA's new "Grace" (game changing new chipsets available early next year) as a step function up on revenues and margins and ebitda)! The other names above have serious upside catalysts too, none of which are being accorded any value. imo This "gifting"on valuation levels won't last as hedge funds and ETFs will soon be re-positioning these names (first).  
 
Everyone who wants out at the bottom on these gems ought to hurry now. jmo, but time is running out to turn bs paper losses into a permanent loss of capital. 
 
"Turnaround Tuesday" on deck
